headline: Baked Ziti
description: Baked ziti pasta with ground beef, spaghetti sauce, and three kinds of Italian cheese makes a surprisingly easy, family-pleasing weeknight meal.

video.description: See how to make five-star baked ziti.
video.name: Baked Ziti I

name: Baked Ziti

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add ziti pasta, and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes; drain.
Meanwhile, brown ground beef and onion in a large skillet over medium heat; stir in spaghetti sauce and simmer for 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Spread 1/2 of the ziti in the bottom of the prepared dish; top with Provolone cheese, sour cream, 1/2 of the meat sauce, remaining ziti, mozzarella cheese, and remaining meat sauce. Top with grated Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and cheeses have melted, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic easy
Everyone LOVES this!

My hubby made this tonight. We loved it. Only change made was to stir the sour cream with noodles. Next time we will fry some chopped red bell pepper with the onions and add italian seasonings to the sauce. The 10"x13"pan was too small for all the noodles so next time we will cut back on how many we boil.
love it thank you

Delicious! And super easy. I had no ziti, used penne. Drained the pasta a few minutes short of al dente. Very moist and plenty of sauce. I only had half of the sour cream and only shredded mozzarella. But still very tasty.
Our GO TO quick easy ZITI recipe. We always add some extra mozarella, but other than that its great.
I made it today and it was amazing. It was so much better than I thought it would be as I had never made ziti before. It took a while but was really easy and so good.
Wonderful! Makes a ton, but still doesn't last long!

I've been making this recipe for years and it always comes out delicious! I use 2 jars of sauce and 2lbs of ground beef, I also mix my sour cream and noodles together and then assemble with the cheese. This is one of my favorite recipes.
This was the best baked Ziti I have had. The ONLY thing I did different was the way I seasoned my ground beef. Other than that I followed exactly. Yum!!!
Best Ziti recipe I’ve made to date! Even the leftovers are still moist.
Extremely bland with the sour cream. Will stick with ricotta in the future.
I will be having this again !!..
Excellent, whole family enjoyed it, even the grand kids!!!!
Family loves it! It's my husband's favorite thing I make!
I made this recipe yesterday for the very first time. It was amazingly delicious. Instead of ground beef i used ground Turkey Italian sausage.

Loved it! To make this even easier, i just bought a bag of pizza blend cheese at Kroger instead of all the cheeses separately, and I only used 8oz of sour cream, Italian sausage, and garlic, and it turned out really well!
Oh my goodness, even my picky eater loved it! Making this again. I ended up using italian sausage, like one user suggested and it turned out delicious! Thank you so much!
I made this, however I dropped the sour cream and changed the cheese to all Mozzarella. That version turned out fantastic.
Great recipe but could be made smaller for small families. Too much for 2 or 3 people.
used 1 lb ground beef and added garlic and onion. Next time add italian sausage to meat mixture.
Made this for 100. Delicious Put together one day and baked the next.
This was delicious. I added onions, green peppers, garlic, and shredded cheddar cheese.
Excellent

This was very good, made as instructed but used ground turkey. I did layer it differently (and wrong) but still came out great. Sprayed the pan with Pam and then I put some sauce on the bottom of my glass 9x13 pan, then added the pasta, some sauce, provolone (6 slices), light sour cream then mozzarella cheese. repeated the layers in that order. I added some extra mozzarella cheese on top. Turned out great! The pan was FULL. Definitely a good potluck dish. We will have having left overs for sure.
I thought this was awesome! i didn’t add sour cream but I did add more mozzarella.

This is the best baked ziti recipe! I made it exactly as written the first time. The next time Ik browned the meat and onion, added the sauce. When that was hot I added the sour cream. This made it a lot easier to put together. Layer sauce, provolone, sauce, mozzarella, sauce, parm. Delicious!
This recipe was perfection! Didn’t need any alterations :) My family and I enjoyed it so much I made two for leftovers!

I've made this numerous times and is one of my go to dishes! It's great for having company because you can have the prep work done before they arrive and gives you time to spend with them. Not to mention its delicious and is a good reheat.
Everyone loves this!
It tasted delicious and everyone liked it. I thought it was a little dry so this time I added some water and that seems perfect.
Would give it 100000 stars if it was an option I absolutely loved this
It was really good.

This is a hearty and easy dish to prepare. Our family is health conscious, so I opted to make this dish with whole wheat pasta and ground turkey. We love garlic, so I added 3 cloves of minced garlic to the ground turkey and onion, while I was sautéing them in the pan. Low sodium one jar of sauce was used instead of 2 regular pasta sauce jars. I added a bunch of dried basil and oregano, and it worked great for us. I think this dish is great, because it's so versatile and easy to tweak for personal preferences. Our family likes a lot of spice. Next time, I am going to add a layer of fresh spinach, which won't change the flavor much at all, but it will sneak in some green veggies.
Great recipe
I make this for my family and it has become a dish that I’m known for making and is often requested.

The pan suggested was too small for the ingredients suggested! Does anyone actually make these dishes before putting the recipe out into the world? So frustrating to not have everything fit in the casserole dish!

I didn’t precook my noodles because my sauce was a bit watery and the pasta absorbed some of that liquid. I’d gave it a 4 because some Italian spices would have been a nice spice add. I liked it. I’ll make it again.
It's good but I think next time I'll replace the sour cream with ricotta.
I made the Baked Ziti and the only change was I added Italian sausage. DELICIOUS!!!

This is a staple in my house. I don't eat beef due to medical issues, so make it with Italian sausage. I use a little more sauce then it calls for, and more mozzarella too. I also undercook the pasta a little bit and it cooks to al dente in the oven. It always seems like it will overflow my 9x13 pyrex but it never does. There are left overs always, but I never get any of those because my family beats me too it!

I love this recipe. I do add some meat sauce to bottom of pan first and add provolone as well as some mozzarella on second layer of noodles. I do that before the remaining meat sauce is put on. I also add shredded mozzarella to top during last 5 min or so of cooking.
This was so delicious! I did add some seasoning to my liking. Garlic salt, crushed red peppers, onion salt, and Italian seasoning. Definitely something I will make again.

I’ve made this many times now. I simply don’t like ricotta cheese and this recipe has saved my ziti life. I only make a few dishes for my family and this is the one that’s enjoyed the most. I always do it vegetarian with fake-beef because not all of us eat meat, but all of us enjoy this ziti.

This baked ziti was sooooo good! I was skeptical about the sour cream as I was brought up with ricotta cheese in all baked zitis and have ever had BUT I decided to try it. I am honestly so happy I did because it’s super tasty. It’s also family approved! I will definitely be making this for a baby shower I’m cooking for. Thank for sharing this great recipe!

I expected something a little bit more decadent, all that work and cost to buy the sour cream the provolone the mozzarella cheese and the Parmesan really all I could’ve done was boil up the ziti put a little sauce on it and sprinkle a little Parmesan would’ve been just as good.
Very easy to manage, though it really needed the two jars of pasta sauce. I added basil and Italian herbs to give it a stronger kick.
Delicious! Also delicious without the meat - I add English Prime Rib Rub to the sauce. I have used many different pastas.

This is a huge crowd pleaser that I have been making for years. It is delicious and hearty and ridiculously simple to make. It has a beautiful blend of sauciness and cheesiness without either overpowering the other. Someone made a comment about it being watery and that tells me they did not let it rest. I simply allowing it to rest after cooking it reabsorbs any extra liquid. In fact we're recently I have started making mine the day before and then reheating it. It is so much better on day two!!

This recipe is very good with one substitution. Being of Italian ancestry I had a hard time with the sour cream. I substituted 1 1/2 cup sour cream with 1 1/2 cup whole milk ricotta. I added fresh parsley, an egg, and some pecorino romano cheese to the ricotta. I feel it's richer and more authentic this way.
It was so easy that I was hesitant to make it. But the family absolutely loved it and ate seconds and thirds. I was surprised at the flavors. Followed the recipe without any changes. Great recipe.
Fine as is. I did think it was better with a 1 TBL of Italian Seasoning.
No pic because they didn't give me a chance to take one...easy and awesome recipe 👌🏽
I'm not sure what I did wrong, but this came out extremely bland.

Because cooking time was limited, I was looking for a recipe that was delicious, easy to put together and would feed a crowd. This was perfect on all accounts. I followed the recipe exactly and my family loved it. The adults and the kids ate it up. I'll be making this one forever. Thanks!

I first tried this recipe after seeing it on the back of a Fred Myer (Kroger) brand Ziti pasta box. It's one of my family's favorites. I always forget how to layer it so I look for a similar recipe to make sure I'm getting it right, I'm pretty sure this one closely matches it. I use the Safeway brand Vodka sauce, cover it for all but the last 10 minutes with tin foil and it turns out prefect!
Excellent.

I have made this ziti more times than I can count. I do made a couple of modifications though. 

1) A little minced garlic in with the onion and meat
2) I use about 3/4 lb of ground beef and 3/4 lb of hot Italian sausage
3) I go a little more generous on the provolone
Tried this recipe and it was delicious… I did swap out the sour cream for cream cheese though and it was perfect. Also if you are not adding a bit of sugar to your sauce you are missing out.
I used mozzarella and monterrey jack cheese with all ingredients
Excellent! The whole family loved it. This dish will now be a part of my main dish meal rotation.
I reduced the sour cream to 1/2c and used 15 OZ Ricotta. No provolone cheese

Made as directed except I halved the recipe and baked it in an 8x8 casserole dish. I also used cellentani instead of Ziti just because I had half a box I needed to use up. Came out delish. A great comfort food for a chilly fall day.
Great recipe! We added green pepper to the meat mixture along with some basil, oregano and a bit of diced garlic. Delicious!

Ok 6000 + reviews got my attention. I have a recipe I use for my baked ziti but to honesty critique this one I first try the recipes exactly as posted for an honest opinion. Saying that this is particularly good as is. But like so many others I made again with my adjustments. First off instead of buttering the dish use a ladle or two of sauce. It won’t make the noodles stick and you can get sauce in every bite so it doesn’t dry out. Next provolone is fine but sour cream in my opinion is better not used instead season the ricotta and use it for authentic taste. Finally the top layer gets Parmesan and mozzarella. Enjoy
This is the BEST recipe that I have found out of the four total recipes that I have tried. It is perfect just the way it is. Thanks!

I loved this version of baked ziti! I ended up using half cottage cheese (meant to get ricotta, but the store subbed) and half sour cream. I LOVED the sour cream in it! Gave it a great flavor and added a creaminess to the dish. Next time I’ll follow the recipe and leave out the ricotta/cottage cheese. Will make again and again!
This recipe is so simple and easy to make. I made this two weeks ago and it’s so delicious. Hubby requested it for dinner again this week.
This is amazing!!! Thank you for the recipe

We make this ziti ALL the time. The cheeses can be changed up in a pinch but we almost always follow the recipe exact. My husband is asked to make this for his family Christmas every year. It’s soooo good! It makes ALOT! This bad boy weighs about 9 1/2 pounds! Yum!

I love cheese, so I never thought I’d say this about a recipe, but this is just too much cheese. Skip the provolone. It really doesn’t add anything, and will make this very hard to eat. Without the provolone this is a great version of ziti. I took others suggestions and put the sauce mixture directly on the pasta, that part turned out great. And cover the dish while cooking.
AMAZING!
Ricotta with an egg instead of provolone was a game changer!
No changes to the recipe. Made it for a birthday party and everyone loved it.
This is a family favorite! I don't change a thing except to put part of the meat mixture down in the dish first so the ziti doesn't stick to the bottom. Love this recipe!

Family enjoyed this one. I was a few ounces short on spaghetti sauce and added a can of crushed tomatoes. I added oregano, basil, rosemary and bayleaf. I did end up with extra sauce which I froze for future use.

I love this recipe! I have had to modify based on ingredients I have on hand. My husband is a vegetarian so we have made it with sauce only and with vegetarian Italian sausage crumbles. Bothe we’re delicious! I’ve even made it with hearty gluten free noodles for a gluten free recipe. I didn’t have provolone so I used all mozzarella. The sour cream makes it moist and creamy. Easy to make and delicious. It’s a keeper!

I made this for dinner and it was a hit. I did make some additions just for personal preference. I used half ground meat and half sweet Italian sausage bc it has the spices I love. I added green peppers and garlic to the onions as well as baby bellas. I like the sour cream over ricotta bc its not as heavy. it was a hit among family served up with toasted Italian bread and a salad. thank you. p.s. sauce on bottom then pasta and cover with foil for 30 mins and then uncovered for 5 mins if you like browned edges like me. YUMMY!!
a regular favorite of the whole family!

A phenomenal recipe!!! I did change a bit, I just made my own red sauce with wine in it and cooked my ground beef with onions and garlic and Italian seasoning. This was ABSOLUTELY delicious! Thank you!!!

Anyone who does not give this 5 stars did not make it right. I have a very diverse family and everyone who eats it loves it, and there are 7 of us. Casserole are the easiest and best dishes to make for a family our size, and we know casseroles and this one is I. The top 5. Thank you. Secret is Hunts in a can traditional sauce
Did 1/2 and we loved it. I didn't have the provolone so sub'd cottage cheese. So yummy!
Used the ricotta method and sharp block cheese with block mozzarella (it’s sister since the didn’t have dry block mozz which turned out identical)

I didn’t think this would be as amazing as it was with sour cream in it. My super picky toddler loved this and it’s the most food he has eaten in one sitting and also for more than one meal. My husband, kids, and parents all loved it! It makes a lot so hopefully you like leftovers or are feeding a big family/group.
I nade this ziti exactly according to the recipe and it was so good! Very quick and easy to make.

It was so good! I feel this is a great recipe that’s so simple to make and you can customize based on the ingredients you like. I made a large batch and did a few different casseroles with differ ingredients to give out to my friends and family.. they all loved it!
Excellent dish. I switched out the ground beef for one pound of ground Italian sweet sausage and one pound of ground mild Italian sausage. Easy to make and even better the next day. A keeper
Made it and it was really good. I removed the sour cream and onion. It was sooo good. Worth it. Will make again because my step child loves it haha.
Made this per recipe and it was delicious!!! I wouldn't change a thing. Thanks for sharing!!

These were so easy to make and they taste great. Very sweet! I followed the advice from the reviewer from New Orleans; cooked 2 minutes, added vanilla and cooled on parchment paper. They came out thin and released right off the paper.
I made a small pan of this while I made regular baked ziti just to try it. Not for me or my family. maybe because I'm Italian, but there is no substituting ricotta with sour cream.
Best ziti recipe ever! This is a family favorite recipe!
Perfect! I've made this recipe over and over.

I followed the recipe except I added more chopped and dry seasoning. But overall this is awesome. The only part that dried out was the little pieces that stuck out. The sauce was enough to keep the dish moist while baking. My family loves it. Did green beans on the side.

Great way to use up any leftover sour cream! I did not have spaghetti sauce, so i made my own with: 15oz canned diced tomatoes, 8oz tomato paste, 1tbps sugar, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp italian seasoning, 1 tsp dried basil, 1 tsp dried parsley, some hot pepper flakes. I also used less cheese since i only had 8oz bag mozarella+provolone mix, and about 2oz leftover shredded mozarella. It was still flavorful enough, i want to think its a little healthier! Turned out great!
I changed it up just a little and not only put a pound of lean beef, but also a pound of mild italian pork. WOW! So yummy!!!!!
I added another layer of provolone slices after the second layer of ziti noodles making it extra cheesy and used Italian sausage instead of beef. My family loved it.

I made an account just to write a review. I first made this recipe when I was 15, and it was a hit! I'm 21 now and I just remade it again. It's still a favorite, it's always devoured and finished. I just made it again and it was a bit too acidic this time, so might need to add in sugar or a little cream (I did use private selection marinara instead which is different than usual). I love love LOVE this dish and will make it for my future kids one day. My siblings and I (3 of us total) managed to eat it for dinner 3x in a row before it finished out. We didn't get tired of it at all. I followed the recipe exactly, except I seasoned the sauce/meat with stuff in my
pantry. I also cover it with foil and cook it for maybe an hour, and also broil it towards the end to crisp up the top. So yummy
This is an excellent recipe! For the meat, I made it half ground beef and half ground mild Italian sausage.
